paragraphs.text: Obama undermines Hillary Clinton in State of the Union address.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: Is President Obama trying to sabotage Hillary Clinton's 2016 presidential run?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: That's one take-away from his feisty State of the Union address
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: in which Mr  Obama did three things
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: first
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: he moved the Democratic agenda far to the left
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: where Hillary is not entirely comfortable
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: second
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: he rebuffed the clear preference of voters that he work with Congress, by making the cornerstone of his address proposals unacceptable to the GOP and third
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: he assured the country that our foreign policy (Hillary's foreign policy) is working
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Americans are not at all convinced, 13 days after the vicious attacks on Charlie Hedbo in Paris, that Obama's "broader strategy" is leading to "a safer, more prosperous world."
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Obama says he believes in a "smarter kind of American leadership"
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: for many in the country, the assertion borders on arrogance
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: None of these messages works for Hillary
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Mr  Obama's focus on the middle class is unsurprising
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Lagging income growth for the average American has emerged as the likely debate in 2016, for good reason
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The numbers show that during the Obama recovery, the middle class has, as Joe Biden put it, been "left behind."
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The issue is valid
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Mr  Obama's progressive approach to helping average Americans- relying on more taxation and more government programs -- is not
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Despite Americans listing job creation as their number one concern for the past six years
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: putting people to work has never been President Obama's priority
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: He has not encouraged businesses to hire
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: either through reducing tax rates on employers or by expanding business opportunities- through trade, or reduced regulations, for instance
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: On the contrary
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: his economic prescriptions have raised costs for employers through the onerous provisions of Obamacare and his efforts to raise the minimum wage
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: As of this SOTU address, he has doubled down
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: since
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: many of the suggested tax hikes will land on small companies that pay taxes as individuals
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: as his proposed sick pay and maternity leave will raise the costs of hiring
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Such policies have led to labor participation rates that are still bumping along historical lows, a crisis in our disability program, and stagnant wages
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: A short course in economics might help the White House
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: a tighter jobs market will raise wages
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The government raising wages will put people out of work
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It's that simple
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Obama revisited his familiar theme of making sure all Americans have a "fair shot"
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: he wants to raise taxes to make sure the rich do "their fair share."
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: He has never laid out what that share should be
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: he has tried hard to convince Americans that the wealthy don't play "by the same set of rules."
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It's a tired song
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Americans have never bought the program
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: A recent Rasmussen poll showed that 60% of Americans think the country is "fair" and "decent."
paragraphs.label: statistics

paragraphs.text: They don't believe that income distribution is the answer
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: They believe in growth, in optimism, in everyone getting ahead
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The tax proposals outlined by President Obama are old school, and dead on arrival in the Republican Congress, as he well knows
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Congress has indicated an eagerness to work with the president on tax reform, but has prioritized changing the dysfunctional corporate tax code
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The president understands that by placing individual tax hikes first in the queue, he has just undermined any chance for bipartisan agreement
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: And, by adopting the priorities of the left, which emphasize wealth redistribution and also embrace further exploiting the financial sector,
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: he is drafting behind liberal icon Senator Elizabeth Warren
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: This is a slap at Hillary, for two reasons
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: First
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Hillary is unquestionably uncomfortable putting on a progressive cloak
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In the fall campaigns she awkwardly mimicked Liz Warren's rhetoric, embarrassing herself with the head-scratcher "Don't let anyone tell you that it's businesses and corporations that create jobs."
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Hillary is a successful, wealthy woman who pretends otherwise and stubs her toe on money issues, such as
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: when she described herself and her husband as "dead broke" upon leaving the White House
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: Also
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Hillary has difficulty distancing herself from Wall Street
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: the Wall Street Journal has reported that she and her husband have raised nearly $5 million from Goldman Sachs alone
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: It's also awkward for Mrs  Clinton that the president has burned relations with Republicans
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: again
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In his speech, while talking about "A better politics" in which "we debate without demonizing each other," the president also threatened to veto a number of GOP initiatives
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Voters have shown they want the government to function - to repair our infrastructure, reform our dreadful tax code, to compete more effectively with our trading rivals, to streamline our outdated government agencies
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: For six years Mr  Obama has blamed the GOP for standing in the way of his programs
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: now he will be the obstructer-in-chief
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: From his State of the Union address, it is clear that he is not interested in partnering with Republicans
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: His aggressive executive actions over the past several weeks on preventing deportation of millions of undocumented immigrants and unilaterally overhauling our Cuba policy were the tip of the iceberg
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Mr  Obama is not into compromise
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Voters do not like the president's"go it alone" program
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: they understand why the nation's founders included those pesky checks and balances
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Obama will make it more difficult for any Democrat trying to succeed him to convince voters that he or she will "work across the aisle" - a claim that Hillary might actually credibly make
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Finally
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: Obama's insufficient resolve against the threat of Islamic terrorism, and conviction that his efforts overseas are bearing fruit, are alarming
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Like Muggles fearful of naming the fearsome Voldemort, Obama seems to think if he just doesn't say "Islamic terrorism" out loud, the menace will pass him by
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: His embarrassing absence in Paris, his waffle on Syria, his underestimation of ISIS- it all speaks to his pretense that we have won the War on Terror
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: That our president can be so misled and so misleading on a matter of such grave importance is horrifying
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: That Hillary Clinton was the enabler of his clueless foreign policy is a serious problem for the former first lady
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: And
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: for the country, should she be elected
paragraphs.label: assumption
